full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 FILING A CLAIM For help in filing a death claim with the insurance company, you should contact your Employee Relations/Personnel repre- sentative. If a benefit claim is denied, you will receive a written statement of the reasons for the denial. You have a right to have the denial reviewed if you wish. Included in the statement you receive will be the name and address of the person you should call or write if you want the denial reviewed. TERMINATION OF COVERAGE Your dependent's life insurance coverage will end on the earliest of the following: When your Honeywell employment ends due to resignation, discharge, layoff or normal retirement. The last day of the last period for which you have made the required contribution An individual dependent's coverage will end on the earliest of the above dates or when that person ceases to be an eligible dependent. In the event you retire early (between ages 55 and 65), you may continue your dependents' life insurance coverage up until your 65th birthday by paying the required monthly premium. BENEFITS AFTER TERMINATION OF COVERAGE In the event of the death of your covered spouse within 31 days after your group coverage ends, the full amount of his/her coverage will be paid to you. 4 PUBLICATION NUMBER 59-7130, AUGUST. 1983 1
